p: Most important are the Journal of Geophysical Research, the Journal of Climate, and the Geophysical Research Letters in terms of the total number of papers published. The journal Climatic Change, which has been founded specifically for research papers on climate change, appears on rank four. Nature as one of the most prominent multidisciplinary journals appears on lower ranks but shows the highest PP Top 50%: Nearly all papers published in Nature belong to the 50% most frequently cited papers. Most journals show a comparatively high citation impact. The proportion of highly received papers (PP Top 1%) is very large for the journals Global Change Biology (PP Top 1% = 5.83%) and Quaternary Science Reviews (PP Top 1% = 4.53%).
